an4.178:4.1: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.
an4.178:4.3: Take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.
an4.178:4.4: They focus on the cessation of identification,
an4.178:4.5: but their mind isn’t eager, confident, steady, and decided about it.
an4.178:4.6: You wouldn’t expect that mendicant to stop identifying.
an4.178:4.7: Suppose a person were to grab a branch with a glue-smeared hand. Their hand would stick, hold, and bind to it.
an4.178:4.8: In the same way, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.
an4.178:4.9: They focus on the cessation of identification,
an4.178:4.10: but their mind isn’t eager, confident, steady, and decided about it.
an4.178:4.11: You wouldn’t expect that mendicant to stop identifying.
an4.178:5.1: Next, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.
an4.178:5.2: They focus on the cessation of identification,
an4.178:5.3: and their mind is eager, confident, steady, and decided about it.
an4.178:5.4: You’d expect that mendicant to stop identifying.
an4.178:5.5: Suppose a person were to grab a branch with a clean hand. Their hand wouldn’t stick, hold, or bind to it.
an4.178:5.6: In the same way, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.
an4.178:5.7: They focus on the cessation of identification,
an4.178:5.8: and their mind is eager, confident, steady, and decided about it.
an4.178:5.9: You’d expect that mendicant to stop identifying.
an4.178:6.1: Next, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.
an4.178:6.3: but their mind isn’t eager, confident, steady, and decided about it.
an4.178:6.4: You wouldn’t expect that mendicant to smash ignorance.
an4.178:6.5: Suppose there was a billabong that had been stagnant for many years.
an4.178:6.6: And someone was to close off the inlets and open up the outlets, and the heavens didn’t provide enough rain.
an4.178:6.7: You wouldn’t expect that billabong to break its banks.
an4.178:6.8: In the same way, take a mendicant who enters and remain in a certain peaceful freedom mind.
an4.178:6.10: but their mind isn’t eager, confident, steady, and decided about it.
an4.178:6.11: You wouldn’t expect that mendicant to smash ignorance.
an4.178:7.1: Next, take a mendicant who enters and remains in a peaceful release of the heart.
an4.178:7.3: and their mind is eager, confident, steady, and decided about it.
an4.178:7.4: You wouldn’t expect that mendicant to smash ignorance.
an4.178:7.5: Suppose there was a billabong that had been stagnant for many years.
an4.178:7.6: And someone was to open up the inlets and close off the outlets, and the heavens provided plenty of rain.
an4.178:7.7: You’d expect that billabong to break its banks.
an4.178:7.8: In the same way, take a mendicant who enters and remain in a certain peaceful freedom mind.
an4.178:7.10: and their mind is eager, confident, steady, and decided about it.
an4.178:7.11: You’d expect that mendicant to smash ignorance.
an4.178:7.12: These are the four people found in the world.”
